Key Arguments: The legislation is totalitarian and inappropriate for a free and democratic society.
Truth does not fear scrutiny, whereas lies require suppression of truth to thrive.
Giving those in power the authority to decide what is true is dangerous and prone to abuse.
The proposal indicates a move towards censorship and Orwellian control.
Notable Quotes: Truth has no fear of scrutiny whilst lies need the truth to be suppressed to take root.
Putting the power of deciding what is truth into the hands of those in power is dangerous and will be abused given human nature.
The fact that this legislation is being proposed shows that we are heading down a dark path into censorship and Orwell-esque control.
